result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chakayla M Straham

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chakayla M Straham in court.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Chakayla M Straham.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:02 PM Defendant Chakayla M Straham in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests cash bail and presents arguments.  Attorney Galang requests the Court reinstate bail and presents arguments.  The Court admonishes defendant but will not increase cash bail today.  The Court quashes the warrant and reinstates bail.  Time limits previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

EXT CODE 3
BODY ONLY.
BAIL JUMPING CASE: Waukesha County Circuit Court case 2021CF001769.

10:50 AM Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court.   Defendant Chakayla M Straham did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Galang states that the Defendant's car broke down on her way here.
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Attorney Galang requests to stay a capias. 
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 3
BODY ONLY.
BAIL JUMPING CASE: Waukesha County Circuit Court case 2021CF001769.

ADA Nesheim requests witness costs.
The Court grants witness costs.
The State to find out the amount and file a letter with the Court as to costs.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Jeremy Perri.
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  Defendant to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS if they deem appropriate.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant is currently on Justice Point in Milwaukee County.  The Court orders the Defendant to report to WCS within 5 business days of being released from Justice Point in Milwaukee County.

02:15 PM Defendant Chakayla M Straham in court, in custody, with attorney Public Defender Law Intern.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant is currently on Justice Point in Milwaukee County.  The Court orders the Defendant to report to WCS within 5 business days of being released from Justice Point in Milwaukee County.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
